Name: Picasso Sour
Ingredients: 45 ml BarSol Mosto Verde Italia Pisco
20 ml Egg white (pasteurised) or 																																			Aquafaba (chickpea water)																								 or 3 dashes Fee Brothers Fee Foam cocktail foamer
10 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°Brix)
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Coupe glass .
Prepare garnish of spray Angostura Bitters through stencil or drip a few drops on surface foam..
SHAKE all ingredients with ice and strain back into shaker.
Review: We were struck by the photograph that accompanied the recipe sent to us by this cocktail's creator. The photo was of the cocktail at Burj Al Arab in Dubai, where it is served with a tiny wooden artist's colour palate alongside a micro easel holding a print of Picasso's Portrait of The Absinthe Drinker . The cocktail itself is an artistic citrus-led riff on a Pisco Sour , but the original presentation amounts to true cocktail artistry.
History: Adapted from a recipe created in 2016 by Sean Halse at Gold On 27, Burj Al Arab, Dubai. Sean says, "The drink was designed to show the artistic side of the modern bartender." (His original recipe called for 40ml Lapostelle Pisco and 10ml 1:1 sugar syrup.)
Nutrition: One serving of Picasso Sour contains 155 calories
